node.title: The company that produced ‘Parasite’ has bought Endeavor’s scripted content arm.
node.alt: Miky Lee, bottom right, at the 2020 Academy Awards ceremony. Ms. Lee, the vice chair of CJ Entertainment, has been nudging the South Korean company to expand its foothold in Hollywood.
node.description: Endeavor was forced to reduce its ownership stake in its scripted content business as a result of a settlement with the Writers Guild of America.
node.content: ["The South Korean media conglomerate whose entertainment arm produced the winner of the 2019 Oscar for best picture, \u201cParasite,\u201d has acquired a majority stake in the scripted arm of Endeavor Content, a subsidiary of the talent agent Endeavor Group.", "Upon closure of the $775 million deal, which was announced late Thursday night, the South Korean conglomerate, CJ ENM, will own 80 percent of the business and the Endeavor Group 20 percent. The companies said they expected the deal to close in the first quarter of 2022.", "The Wall Street Journal reported the news earlier.", "\u201cAt the end of the day, CJ ENM strives to become a major global studio that encompasses content that appeals to a global audience \u2014 like this deal with Endeavor Content, we will continue to expand our presence in the global market,\u201d Kang Ho-Sung, the conglomerate\u2019s chief executive, said in a statement.", "Endeavor is being forced to reduce its ownership stake in its scripted content business as a result of a settlement this year with the Writers Guild of America, whose writers went on strike to protest what they saw as a conflict of interest at agencies that owned both talent representation businesses and production companies.", "Endeavor is not required to sell its unscripted assets and will maintain 100 percent ownership of that business.", "Endeavor Content was formed in 2017 by Graham Taylor and Chris Rice. Today, it calls itself a global film and television studio, and it has produced such projects as \u201cNine Perfect Strangers,\u201d a Hulu mini-series starring Nicole Kidman, and Maggie Gyllenhaal\u2019s directorial debut, \u201cThe Lost Daughter.\u201d It owns a minority stake in Bruna Papandrea\u2019s production company, Made Up Stories, in addition to PictureStart and Media Res.", "Mr. Taylor and Mr. Rice will remain co-chief executives of the new company.", "CJ has been expanding its foothold in Hollywood in recent years. Miky Lee, the vice chair of CJ Entertainment, the Hollywood arm of CJ ENM, rose to the national stage when she accepted the best picture Oscar for \u201cParasite,\u201d but she was an industry player before then, nudging CJ toward Hollywood in the 1990s with a stake in DreamWorks. Most recently, she invested $100 million in David Ellison\u2019s Skydance Media and was elected vice chair of the board of the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures.", "\u201cHaving known Miky Lee for more than 25 years, I\u2019m confident that CJ ENM will be excellent stewards of the studio, accelerating and amplifying its projects on a global stage,\u201d Ari Emanuel, the chief executive of Endeavor, said in a statement."]
